feed.title: Courtot Lab
feed.subtitle: The Courtot lab develops new software, databases and other necessary components to store, organize and compute over the large and complex datasets being generated by research programs.

entry.title: Welcome Pratham!
entry.content: The Courtot lab is hosting its first summer intern, Pratham Hemlani. Pratham is in his third year of undergraduate studies in Statistics and Economics at the University of Toronto, and joins the lab thanks to a T-Cairem award. Pratham will work on LLM-based data extraction from Ontario Hereditary Cancer Network reports to retrieve structure data and harmonize variant information using Global Alliance for Genomics and Health standards.
entry.summary: The Courtot lab is hosting its first summer intern, Pratham Hemlani. Pratham is in his third year of undergraduate studies in Statistics and Economics at the University of Toronto, and joins the lab thanks to a T-Cairem award. Pratham will work on LLM-based data extraction from Ontario Hereditary Cancer Network reports to retrieve structure data and harmonize variant information using Global Alliance for Genomics and Health standards.

entry.title: GA4GH Connect
entry.content:
Last week Jon Eubank, technical associate director in the Genome Informatics team and I had the pleasure to attend the GA4GH Connect meeting in Ascona, Switzerland.

We heard and contributed to differnt sessions around implementing Beacon for ICGC-ARGO and the Pan Canadian Genome Library (PCGL), as well as work the Regulatory and Ethics working group is initiating. Jon talked about our work on Overture and I presented the new PCGL project to the Steering Committee, highlighting connections between PCGL and GA4GH, with my colleagues David Bujold and Maâ€™n Zawaati. Slides for the PCGL GA4GH intro are available here.
entry.summary: Last week Jon Eubank, technical associate director in the Genome Informatics team and I had the pleasure to attend the GA4GH Connect meeting in Ascona, Switzerland.
